body.p: A fixed-fee service contract is a contract in which the level of service depends on an uncertain event. Examples include roadside assistance programmes and maintenance contracts in which the service provider agrees to repair specified equipment after a malfunction. Such contracts meet the definition of an insurance contract because:

li.p: it is uncertain whether, or when, assistance or a repair will be needed;
the owner is adversely affected by the occurrence; and
the service provider compensates the owner if assistance or repair is needed.
